definitions: Five-day Hindu festival of lights celebrated nationwide, honoring crows, dogs, cows, and sibling bonds.
Widely observed in urban and rural Nepal; especially vibrant in Kathmandu Valley, Tarai towns, and hill districts.
Primarily celebrated by Nepali Hindus and Newars (as Mha Puja/Yamari Punhi linkage), with participation from many communities.
examplesRomanized: tiharma gharma dip jalainchha.
exampleEnglish: During Tihar, lamps are lit at home.

definitions: Commemoration of the divine marriage of Rama and Sita marked by grand processions and rituals in Janakpur.
Centred in Madhesh Province (Janakpur and surrounding Tarai districts), drawing pilgrims from Nepal and India.
Celebrated mainly by Maithil/Madhesi Hindus, with broad Hindu participation.
examples: विवाह पञ्चमीमा जनकपुरमा विशेष मेला लाग्छ।
examplesRomanized: vivah panchamima janakpurma vishes mela lagchha.
exampleEnglish: A special fair is held in Janakpur on Vivah Panchami.

definitions: Day to honor fathers/ancestors; people offer prayers, gifts, and remembrance.
Observed across Nepal in homes and temples; city shrines and ghats see heavy crowds.
Observed widely by Hindu households across ethnic groups.
examplesRomanized: kushe aunsima babulai sammaan garinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Kuse Aunsi, fathers are honored.

definitions: Day of honoring mothers and departed maternal ancestors; offerings and visits to mothers are customary.
Famous pilgrimage at Mata Tirtha (Kathmandu), with observances nationwide.
Primarily observed by Hindu communities; widely followed across ethnic groups.
examples: मातातीर्थ औँसीमा आमालाई भेटेर आशीर्वाद लिन्छन्।
examplesRomanized: mata tirtha aunsima aamalai bhetara ashirbad linchhan.
exampleEnglish: On Mata Tirtha Aunsi, people visit mothers for blessings.

definitions: Newar festival to ward off evil and illness; effigies are erected and symbolically driven away/burned.
Most prominent in Kathmandu Valley Newar settlements; also observed in nearby towns.
Celebrated by Newars; other Hindu neighbors often join local customs.
examplesRomanized: gathemangalma ashubh shaktilai tadana garinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Gathemangal, evil forces are ritually driven away.

definitions: Sacred Ekadashi marking the close of Chaturmas; devotees fast and visit Vishnu temples.
Observed across Nepal; notable crowds at Narayan temples in Kathmandu Valley and hill regions.
Celebrated mainly by Hindu Vaishnav devotees across diverse ethnic groups.
examplesRomanized: haribodhini ekadashima tirthayatra garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Pilgrimages are undertaken on Haribodhini Ekadashi.

definitions: Pilgrimage fair to the alpine lake Gosaikunda during Janai Purnima; ritual bathing and thread-changing.
Centres in Rasuwa (Langtang region); pilgrims trek from across Nepal and India.
Observed by Hindu and Buddhist devotees (Tamang, Sherpa, and hill Hindu communities).
examplesRomanized: gosainkunda melama bhaktajan gosainkunda pugchhan.
exampleEnglish: Devotees trek to Gosaikunda during the fair.

definitions: Periodic holy fair held at Panauti at the confluence of rivers; ritual baths and donations earn merit.
Focused in Panauti (Kavrepalanchok) with visitors from the Valley and mid-hills.
Observed by Hindu communities across ethnic lines.
examples: मकर मेलामा स्नान तथा दानको पुण्य मानिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: makar melama snan tatha dan ko punya maninchha.
exampleEnglish: Bathing and charity are considered meritorious at Makar Mela.

definitions: Newar Buddhist holy month marked by dawn musical processions, alms, and monastery circumambulations.
Centred in Kathmandu Valley Newar Buddhist quarters; also noted in Newar towns.
Celebrated primarily by Newar Buddhists; other Buddhists also participate.
examplesRomanized: gunla parwama vihar parikrama garinchha.
exampleEnglish: During Gunla, devotees circumambulate monasteries.

definitions: Ritual marriage of the Tulsi plant to Vishnu, signaling start of the marriage season.
Observed at household courtyards and Vaishnav temples across Nepal.
Practiced chiefly by Hindu Vaishnav households across ethnic groups.
examplesRomanized: tulsi vivahma tulsiko mandap sajainchha.
exampleEnglish: A pavilion is decorated for Tulsi Vivah.

definitions: Bikram Samvat New Year on Baisakh 1; marked by processions, picnics, and temple visits.
Celebrated nationwide; fairs and concerts common in cities and towns.
Observed across communities and ethnic groups.
examples: नेपाली नयाँ वर्षमा शुभकामना आदानप्रदान गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: nepali naya barshama shubhakamana adanpradan garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Greetings are exchanged on Nepali New Year.

definitions: Festival marking the birth of Hanuman; devotees visit Hanuman shrines and recite Ramayana hymns.
Observed in cities and towns throughout Nepal; major temples see special aarti.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees across ethnic communities.
examplesRomanized: hanuman jayantima mandirma aarti hunchha.
exampleEnglish: Aarti is performed at temples on Hanuman Jayanti.

definitions: Festival affirming the bond of protection between siblings; sisters tie rakhi/doro and pray for brothers’ well‑being.
Observed across Nepal in both hills and Tarai; often coincides with Janai Purnima wrist thread traditions.
Celebrated mainly by Hindu households across many ethnic groups.
examplesRomanized: rakshabandhanma dajubhailai rakhi badhinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Raksha Bandhan, rakhis are tied to brothers.

definitions: Far‑western festival venerating Gaura/Parvati and Shiva with vrata, songs, and community rituals (Deuda dance).
Most prominent in Sudurpashchim and Karnali provinces; village squares host processions and dances.
Celebrated mainly by Khas communities (Khas Arya and Dalit groups) of the far‑west; others join locally.
examplesRomanized: gaura parvama deuda khelinchha.
exampleEnglish: During Gaura Parva, Deuda is performed.

definitions: Spring Durga festival regarded as a smaller Dashain; temples perform special pūjā and animal offerings in places.
Observed across Nepal in temples and homes, especially in hill districts and the Valley.
Celebrated by Hindu communities across ethnic groups.
examplesRomanized: chaite dashainma deviko puja garinchha.
exampleEnglish: The Goddess is worshipped on Chaite Dashain.

definitions: New Year of the Nepal Sambat calendar featuring processions, traditional music, and lights in the old city cores.
Centred in Kathmandu Valley (Kathmandu, Lalitpur, Bhaktapur) with events in Newar towns.
Celebrated primarily by Newar communities; many non‑Newars participate.
examples: नेपाल सम्बत नयाँ वर्षमा पदयात्रा निस्कन्छ।
examplesRomanized: nepal sambat naya barshama padyatra niskanchha.
exampleEnglish: Processions are held on Nepal Sambat New Year.

definitions: Newar ritual of self‑worship and purification performed during Tihar/ Nepal Sambat New Year to affirm inner divinity.
Most common in Kathmandu Valley Newar households; community celebrations in Newar localities.
Celebrated by Newars; friends and guests may be invited.
examplesRomanized: mha pujama atmapuja garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Self-worship is performed during Mha Puja.

definitions: Ceremonial public display of the sacred vest (bhoto) at Jawalakhel, closing the Rato Machhindranath cycle.
Centred in Lalitpur (Jawalakhel) in the Kathmandu Valley, drawing huge crowds.
Celebrated by Newar communities; people from all over attend.
examplesRomanized: bhoto jatramama bhoto dekhaainchha.
exampleEnglish: During Bhoto Jatra, the vest is displayed.

definitions: Classical Newar dance‑drama series from the Malla era depicting Hindu deities and myths through nightly performances.
Performed in Patan (Lalitpur) courtyards during the Kartik month; also staged in other Valley sites.
Celebrated by Newar communities; enjoyed by broader audiences.
examples: कार्तिक नाचमा धार्मिक नाटक प्रदर्शन हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: kartik naachma dharmik natak pradarshan hunchha.
exampleEnglish: Religious dance-drama is performed in Kartik Naach.

definitions: Sherpa Buddhist festival with masked Cham dances, empowerments, and prayers at monasteries (Tengboche/Thame/Chiwong).
Prominent in the Khumbu and Solukhumbu region; also observed by Sherpa communities in Kathmandu.
Celebrated by Sherpas and other Himalayan Buddhists (Tamang, Tibetan communities).
examples: मणी रिम्दुमा गुम्बामा छ्याम नाच हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: mani rimduma gumbama chhyam naach hunchha.
exampleEnglish: Cham dances are performed at monasteries during Mani Rimdu.

definitions: Mustang’s post‑monsoon horse festival featuring races, archery, and community feasts.
Centred around Lo‑Manthang, Muktinath/Jomsom areas in Mustang district.
Celebrated by local Tibetan‑Buddhist and Thakali communities; visitors join festivities.
examplesRomanized: yarthungma ghoda daud hunchha.
exampleEnglish: Horse races are held during Yarthung.

definitions: Islamic festival marking the end of Ramadan; includes morning namaz, feasting, and charity (zakat al-fitr).
Observed by Muslim communities across Nepal, notably in Tarai towns and urban centres like Kathmandu.
Celebrated by Nepali Muslims (Madhesi, Kashmiri-origin, and hill Muslim communities).
examplesRomanized: id ul-fitrma namaz padhinchha.
exampleEnglish: Namaz is offered on Eid al-Fitr.

definitions: Festival of sacrifice commemorating Abrahamic devotion; involves prayers and qurbani shared with the needy.
Observed nationwide wherever Muslim communities reside; large congregations in Tarai districts and cities.
Celebrated by Nepali Muslims across ethnic backgrounds.
examplesRomanized: id ul-adhama qurbani garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Qurbani is performed on Eid al-Adha.

definitions: Christian festival celebrating the birth of Jesus Christ; includes church services, carols, and sharing meals.
Observed by Christian communities across Nepal, with services in Kathmandu Valley and many hill towns.
Celebrated by Nepali Christians; neighbors of diverse groups often join.
examplesRomanized: krismasma churchma prarthana garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Prayers are held at churches on Christmas.

definitions: Kirat spring festival praying for rains and good harvest; features community dances (Sakela/Sakewa).
Prominent among Kirat areas of eastern hills and Kathmandu Valley Kirat communities.
Celebrated by Rai, Limbu, Sunuwar, Yakkha (Kirat groups).
examplesRomanized: ubhaulima kiraat samudayle sakela nachchha.
exampleEnglish: During Ubhauli, the Kirat community performs the Sakela dance.

definitions: Kirat autumn thanksgiving marking migration to lower altitudes and harvest completion; dances and feasts held.
Observed in eastern hills and cities with Kirat populations.
Celebrated by Kirat communities (Rai, Limbu, Sunuwar, Yakkha).
examplesRomanized: udhaulima annabliko dhanyabad diinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Udhauli, thanks are offered for the harvest.

definitions: Kirat circle-dance festival (also called Sakewa) invoking nature and ancestors; communal drums and songs.
Centred in eastern hills and Kathmandu Valley Kirat neighbourhoods.
Celebrated by Kirat groups, with wider community attendance.
examplesRomanized: sakelama golbaddha bhayera nachinchha.
exampleEnglish: During Sakela, people dance in circles.

definitions: Longest chariot festival in Patan/Lalitpur honouring rain and fertility deity (Bunga Dyah/Rato Machhindranath).
Centred in Lalitpur (Kathmandu Valley) with processions through Newar quarters.
Celebrated mainly by Newars; people from across Nepal participate.
examplesRomanized: rato machhindranath jatramama rath taninchha.
exampleEnglish: During the Rato Machhindranath Jatra, the chariot is pulled.

definitions: Chariot procession of Seto Machhindranath (Janabaha Dyo) through Kathmandu’s core, praying for prosperity and health.
Centred in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu Valley).
Celebrated by Newar communities, joined by Valley residents.
examplesRomanized: seto machhindranathko rath saharma ghumainchha.
exampleEnglish: Seto Machhindranath's chariot is taken around the city.

definitions: Newar festival dedicated to Kumar Kartikeya and community sanitation; wells and ponds are cleaned.
Observed throughout Kathmandu Valley Newar settlements.
Celebrated by Newars; others participate in clean-up drives.
examples: सिथि नख:मा कुवा पोखरी सफा गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: sithi nakhama kuwa pokhari safa garinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Sithi Nakha, wells and ponds are cleaned.

definitions: Procession of the Living Goddess Kumari in Kathmandu; chariot rides and public darshan.
Centred in Basantapur and surrounding core of Kathmandu (Valley).
Celebrated primarily by Newars; attended by people of many groups.
examples: कुमारी जात्रामामा जीवित देवीको दर्शन गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: kumari jatramama jivit deviko darshan garinchha.
exampleEnglish: During Kumari Jatra, people receive darshan of the Living Goddess.

definitions: Festival of learning and spring, dedicated to Saraswati; students and musicians worship instruments and books.
Observed nationwide in schools, homes, and temples; notable in Valley and hill towns.
Celebrated by Hindu communities and many Buddhists.
examplesRomanized: basant panchamima saraswati puja garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Saraswati Puja is performed on Basant Panchami.

definitions: Festival marking the birth of Lord Rama; special puja, kirtans, and readings from the Ramayana.
Observed in temples across Nepal; Janakpur and urban shrines are focal points.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees across ethnic groups.
examplesRomanized: ram navamima mandirma vishes puja hunchha.
exampleEnglish: Special worship is held at temples on Ram Navami.

definitions: Festival of Krishna’s birth observed with fasting, night vigils, and kirtans; temples remain open late.
Observed nationwide; major gatherings at Krishna shrines in Patan and across towns.
Celebrated by Vaishnav Hindus and wider Hindu communities.
examplesRomanized: janmashtamima bhajan kirtan garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Bhajans and kirtans are performed on Janmashtami.

definitions: Nine nights devoted to Goddess Durga with fasting, rituals, and cultural programs; culminates in Dashain rites.
Observed throughout Nepal, especially in temples and community halls.
Celebrated by Hindu communities across ethnic groups.
examplesRomanized: navaratrima deviko puja garinchha.
exampleEnglish: During Navaratri, the Goddess is worshipped.

definitions: Day of serpent veneration for protection and rains; homes post serpent images at doorways.
Observed across Nepal; strong traditions in Kathmandu Valley and mid-hill villages.
Celebrated by Hindu households across ethnicities.
examplesRomanized: naag panchamima naagko puja garinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Nag Panchami, serpents are worshipped.

definitions: National paddy planting day (Asar 15) marking the start of monsoon agriculture; mud-play and feasts common.
Observed in farming regions nationwide; especially lively in hill terraces and Tarai fields.
Participated in by farming communities across ethnic groups.
examplesRomanized: ropain diwasma khetma ropai garinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Ropain Diwas, rice planting is done in the fields.

definitions: Tharu New Year marked by family gatherings, feasts, and community dances.
Centred in the Tarai (Tharu heartlands) with celebrations in towns and villages.
Celebrated primarily by Tharu communities; others join locally.
examplesRomanized: maghima tharu samudayle bhoj garcha.
exampleEnglish: During Maghi, the Tharu community holds feasts.

definitions: Tamang New Year with traditional dances (Tamang selo), music, and community feasts.
Observed in Tamang-majority mid-hill districts and Kathmandu Valley.
Celebrated by Tamang communities; broader public participates in events.
examples: सोनाम ल्होसारमा नयाँ वर्षको स्वागत गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: sonam lhosarma naya barsako swagat garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Sonam Lhosar marks the Tamang New Year.

definitions: Gurung New Year celebrated with rodhi songs, dances, and communal feasting.
Prominent in western/mid-western hills and Gurung settlements in cities.
Celebrated by Gurung (Tamu) communities; open public events common.
examplesRomanized: tamu lhosarma samudayik karyakram hunchha.
exampleEnglish: Community programs are held on Tamu Lhosar.

definitions: Sherpa New Year observed with monastery ceremonies and masked dances (Cham).
Centred in Himalayan regions (Khumbu) and Sherpa communities in Kathmandu.
Celebrated by Sherpa communities; other Himalayan Buddhists join.
examplesRomanized: gyalpo lhosarma gumbama puja garinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Gyalpo Lhosar, worship is performed at monasteries.

definitions: Nepal’s biggest Hindu festival celebrating the triumph of Durga over evil; families gather for tika and jamara blessings.
Observed nationwide across hills and Tarai; village and city celebrations last for days.
Celebrated by Nepali Hindus of many ethnic groups (Khas Arya, Newar, Madhesi, others).
examplesRomanized: dashainma tika ra jamara lagainchha.
exampleEnglish: During Dashain, tika and jamara are worn.

definitions: Tibetan/Himalayan New Year marked by monastery rituals, family feasts, and cultural programs.
Centred in Himalayan districts and in Tibetan/Sherpa/Buddhist communities in Kathmandu.
Celebrated mainly by Tibetan, Sherpa, and Himalayan Buddhist groups (distinct Sonam/Tamu Lhosar variants exist).
examplesRomanized: losarma naya barsako shubhakamana diinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Losar, New Year greetings are exchanged.

definitions: Hindu sun-worship festival honouring Surya with riverbank rituals at dawn and dusk over four days.
Most prominent in the Tarai (Madhesh Province) and in Tarai migrant communities in cities.
Celebrated mainly by Maithil/Madhesi Hindus; many others respectfully observe.
examplesRomanized: chhathma suryalai arghya diinchha.
exampleEnglish: During Chhath, offerings are made to the sun.

definitions: Mid‑winter festival marking the sun’s northward turn; families eat sesame sweets, ghee, and yam.
Observed across Nepal in both hills and Tarai with local fairs and bathing rites.
Celebrated by Hindu households of many ethnic communities (Tharu observe Maghi as New Year).
examplesRomanized: maghe sankrantima tilko laddu khanchhan.
exampleEnglish: On Maghe Sankranti, people eat sesame laddus.

definitions: Festival of colors (Holi) with playful splashing of coloured water and powders; promotes social harmony.
Celebrated nationwide, typically one day earlier in the Tarai than in the hills.
Observed widely by Hindu communities and the broader public.
examplesRomanized: fagu purnimama rang khelinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Holi, colors are played.

definitions: Women’s festival with fasting, dancing, and prayers to Parvati for marital well‑being and family prosperity.
Observed in Kathmandu Valley and hill regions, with large gatherings at Shiva temples.
Celebrated by Hindu women across ethnic groups (Khas Arya, Newar, others).
examplesRomanized: teejma mahilaharu vrat baschhan.
exampleEnglish: During Teej, women observe fasting.

definitions: Kathmandu’s grand Newar festival honouring Indra, featuring chariot processions, masked dances, and sacred displays.
Centred in Kathmandu’s historic core (Basantapur, Ason, Indra Chowk).
Celebrated primarily by Newars; attended by residents from all communities.
examplesRomanized: indra jatramama nachgaan hunchha.
exampleEnglish: There are dances and celebrations during Indra Jatra.

definitions: Newar festival of remembrance where families who lost members hold humorous processions to ease grief.
Most notable in Kathmandu Valley cities (Kathmandu, Bhaktapur, Lalitpur).
Celebrated by Newars; others spectate and join local events.
examplesRomanized: gaijatrama ghar gharma julus niskanchha.
exampleEnglish: During Gai Jatra, processions go house to house.

definitions: Night of remembrance for departed souls with oil lamps, seed‑scattering, and all‑night vigils.
Major observances around Pashupatinath/Mrigasthali (Kathmandu) and in many hill temples.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees, especially Newar and hill communities.
examplesRomanized: bala chaturdashima diva balinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Bala Chaturdashi, lamps are lit.

definitions: Horse festival with military equestrian displays at Tundikhel believed to ward off evil spirits.
Centred in Kathmandu city (Tundikhel) with citywide festivities.
Observed by Kathmandu residents; rooted in Newar traditions and civic celebrations.
examplesRomanized: ghode jatramama ghodako daud dekhinchha.
exampleEnglish: Horse races are seen during Ghode Jatra.

definitions: Bhaktapur’s New Year chariot festival featuring the tug‑of‑war of Bhairav and Bhadrakali chariots.
Centred in Bhaktapur and Thimi (Kathmandu Valley).
Celebrated by Newar communities; thousands of visitors join.
examplesRomanized: bisket jatramama rath taninchha.
exampleEnglish: Chariots are pulled during Bisket Jatra.

definitions: Newar post‑harvest full‑moon festival marked by making and sharing yomari (sweet rice‑flour dumplings).
Observed across Kathmandu Valley Newar settlements.
Celebrated by Newars; many non‑Newars enjoy the culinary tradition.
examples: योमरी पुन्हीमा योमरी खाने चलन छ।
examplesRomanized: yomari punhima yomari khane chalan chha.
exampleEnglish: On Yomari Punhi, people traditionally eat yomari.

definitions: Great night of Shiva with fasting, night vigils, and massive pilgrimages to Shiva temples.
Pashupatinath (Kathmandu) is the focal point; observed across Nepal.
Celebrated by Hindu Shaivites and devotees from many communities.
examplesRomanized: mahashivaratri ma pashupatinathma mela lagchha.
exampleEnglish: A fair is held at Pashupatinath on Maha Shivaratri.

definitions: Birth, enlightenment, and parinirvana day of the Buddha observed with prayers, alms, and processions.
Major celebrations in Lumbini, Boudhanath, and Swayambhu; observed nationwide.
Celebrated by Buddhist communities (Newar, Sherpa, Tamang, Tibetan) and many Hindus.
examplesRomanized: buddha jayantima shanti yatraharu niskanchhan.
exampleEnglish: Peace processions are held on Buddha Jayanti.

definitions: Full‑moon festival when Brahmin/Chhetri men renew the sacred thread; many receive protective doro on wrists.
Observed across Nepal; linked with pilgrimages such as Gosaikunda in the hills.
Celebrated by Hindu communities across ethnic groups.
examples: जनै पूर्णिमामा जनै फेर्ने प्रथा छ।
examplesRomanized: janai purnimama janai pherne pratha chha.
exampleEnglish: On Janai Purnima, the sacred thread is changed.

definitions: Regional fair at Baglung Kalika temple with pilgrimages, offerings, and cultural programs.
Centred in Baglung district; draws devotees from Gandaki and neighbouring regions.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees across ethnic groups.
examples: बागलुङ कालिका मेलामा भक्तजनको भीड लाग्छ।
examplesRomanized: baglung kalika melama bhaktajanko bhid lagchha.
exampleEnglish: Crowds of devotees gather at the Baglung Kalika Mela.

definitions: Local fair around the historic Rani Mahal on the Kali Gandaki river, featuring cultural showcases and worship.
Centred in Palpa district (Tansen/Rani Mahal area).
Celebrated by local communities and visitors.
examples: रानीमहल मेलामा सांस्कृतिक कार्यक्रमहरू आयोजना हुन्छन्।
examplesRomanized: ranimahal melama sanskritik karyakramharu ayojana hunchhan.
exampleEnglish: Cultural programs are organized during the Rani Mahal fair.

definitions: Festival honouring Bhimsen, patron of traders and strength, with processions and market rituals.
Observed in Newar towns (Patan, Bhaktapur) and hill bazaars.
Celebrated by Newar merchant guilds and local communities.
examples: भीमसेन जात्रामामा व्यापारीहरूले विशेष पूजा गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: bhimsen jatramama byaparile vishes puja garchhan.
exampleEnglish: During Bhimsen Jatra, traders perform special worship.

definitions: Pilgrimage and cultural fair at the historic Gorkha Durbar and Gorakhkali/Gorakhnath shrines.
Centred in Gorkha district; attracts visitors from across Nepal.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees and local communities.
examples: गोरखा दरबार मेलामा दर्शनार्थीहरूको भीड लाग्छ।
examplesRomanized: gorkha darbar melama darshanarthiharu ko bhid lagchha.
exampleEnglish: Large crowds visit the Gorkha Durbar Mela for darshan.

definitions: Temple fair at Kalinchowk Bhagawati with snow‑peak pilgrimages, offerings, and winter treks.
Centred in Dolakha district; draws pilgrims from Kathmandu Valley and eastern/central hills.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees across ethnic groups.
examples: कालिञ्चोक मेलामा भक्तजनले शिखरमाथि पूजा गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: kalinchowk melama bhaktajanele shikhar mathi puja garchhan.
exampleEnglish: At Kalinchowk Mela, devotees worship atop the peak.

definitions: Holy fair at Swargadwari Ashram with fire rituals, alms, and pilgrim camps.
Centred in Pyuthan (mid‑west); pilgrims arrive from Rapti and neighbouring provinces.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees across ethnic groups.
examples: स्वर्गद्वारी मेलामा दर्शन र दान गर्नेहरूको भीड लाग्छ।
examplesRomanized: swargadwari melama darshan ra dan garne haruko bhid lagchha.
exampleEnglish: Crowds gather for darshan and charity at the Swargadwari fair.

definitions: Pilgrimage fair at Barahakshetra (Chatara) on auspicious days with river confluence bathing and worship.
Centred in Sunsari (Koshi confluence); eastern Tarai and hill devotees attend in large numbers.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees from many ethnic communities.
examples: बराहक्षेत्र मेलामा श्रद्धालुहरूले चटारा घाटमा स्नान गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: barahakshetra melama shraddaluharu le chatara ghatma snan garchhan.
exampleEnglish: At Barahakshetra Mela, devotees bathe at the Chatara ghats.

definitions: Fair at the reclining Vishnu (Budhanilkantha) on Haribodhini Ekadashi and other auspicious days.
Centred at Budhanilkantha (Kathmandu); Valley residents and pilgrims visit in droves.
Celebrated by Vaishnav and other Hindu devotees.
examples: बुढानीलकण्ठ मेलामा विष्णुको दर्शनका लागि लामो लाइन लाग्छ।
examplesRomanized: budhanilkantha melama vishnuko darshan ka lagi lamo line lagchha.
exampleEnglish: Long queues form for Vishnu’s darshan at the Budhanilkantha fair.

definitions: Lake‑island temple fair of Tal Barahi with boat pilgrimages and lakeside worship.
Centred in Pokhara (Phewa Lake); Kaski and Gandaki visitors gather on holy days.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees and local communities.
examples: ताल बाराही मेलामा डुङ्गाबाट मन्दिर पुगेर पूजा गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: tal barahi melama dunga bata mandir pugera puja garinchha.
exampleEnglish: At the Tal Barahi fair, devotees reach the temple by boat for worship.

definitions: Temple fair at Bindhyabasini with goddess worship and cultural programs on festival days.
Centred in Pokhara city; attracts devotees from across Gandaki Province.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees across ethnic groups.
examples: बिन्द्यबासिनी मेलामा भक्तजनले विशेष पूजा गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: bindhyabasini melama bhaktajanele vishes puja garchhan.
exampleEnglish: Devotees perform special worship at the Bindhyabasini fair.

definitions: Fair in Khaptad region honouring Khaptad Baba with pilgrimages, meditation, and community feasts.
Centred in Khaptad National Park area (Sudurpashchim).
Celebrated by devotees from far‑western hills across ethnic groups.
examples: खप्तड बाबा मेलामा भक्तजन धाममा पुगेर ध्यान र दर्शन गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: khaptad baba melama bhaktajan dhamma pugera dhyan ra darshan garchhan.
exampleEnglish: At the Khaptad Baba fair, devotees meditate and take darshan at the holy site.

definitions: Sacred lake fair at Mai Pokhari with offerings to local deities and conservation rituals.
Centred in Ilam district; eastern hill communities gather annually.
Celebrated by Kirat, Hindu, and Buddhist devotees.
examples: माइपोखरी मेलामा सरोवर वरिपरि पूजा र प्रदक्षिणा गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: mai pokhari melama sarowar waripari puja ra pradakshina garinchha.
exampleEnglish: At the Mai Pokhari fair, devotees perform worship and circumambulation around the lake.

definitions: Jivitputrika (Jitiya) fast observed by mothers for the well‑being and longevity of their children.
Prominent in the Tarai/Madhesh and Mithila belt; also observed by migrants in cities.
Celebrated mainly by Maithil/Madhesi Hindu women; Tharu and other communities also observe locally.
examples: जीतियामा आमाहरू सन्तानको दीर्घायुका लागि व्रत बस्छन्।
examplesRomanized: jitiya ma aamaharu santanko dirghayuka lagi vrat baschhan.
exampleEnglish: On Jitiya, mothers fast for their children's long life.

definitions: Mithila siblings’ festival where clay birds (Sama and Chakeva) are crafted and exchanged celebrating sister‑brother bonds.
Centred in the Mithila/Tarai region; observed in urban Mithila communities as well.
Celebrated by Maithil communities; others in the Tarai also participate.
examples: समा–चकेवामा दिदीबहिनीले माटोका पंछी साटासाट गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: sama‑chakewama didi bahinile matoka panchhi satasat garchhan.
exampleEnglish: During Sama–Chakeva, sisters exchange clay birds.

definitions: Limbu harvest festival thanking nature and ancestors with offerings and community feasts.
Observed in eastern hills (Limbuwan) and Limbu communities in cities.
Celebrated primarily by Limbu (Yakthung) communities.
examplesRomanized: chasok tangnamma prakritilai dhanyabad diinchha.
exampleEnglish: During Chasok Tangnam, thanks are offered to nature.

definitions: Hill festival of earth‑worship seeking land fertility and community well‑being; includes communal rites and dances.
Observed in mid‑hill districts and Magar villages; variants occur among Rai and Gurung groups.
Celebrated primarily by Magar communities; also observed by Rai/Gurung in local forms.
examples: भूमे पूजामा गाउँलेहरूले जमिनको पूजा गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: bhume pujama gauleharule jamin ko puja garchhan.
exampleEnglish: At Bhume Puja, villagers worship the land.

definitions: Khokana’s Newar festival dedicated to Rudrayani with masked dances and processions in open fields.
Centred in Khokana (Lalitpur) of Kathmandu Valley.
Celebrated by Newar communities; spectators from across the Valley attend.
examples: सिकाली जात्रामामा मुखौटे नाच प्रदर्शन गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: sikali jatramama mukhaute naach pradarshan garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Masked dances are performed during Sikali Jatra.

definitions: Newar spring festival honouring Ajima goddesses with feasts and processions; coincides around Ghode Jatra period.
Observed in Kathmandu Valley Newar neighbourhoods.
Celebrated by Newar communities; locals of many groups join events.
examples: पहां चह्रेमामा अजिमाहरूको सम्मानमा जुलुस निकालिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: pahan chahrema ajimaharuko sammaanma julus nikalinchha.
exampleEnglish: During Pahan Chahre, processions honour the Ajima goddesses.

definitions: Buddhist festival commemorating the Buddha’s descent from the heavenly realm; merit‑making and prayers held.
Observed in Himalayan districts and Buddhist monasteries in cities.
Celebrated by Tibetan, Sherpa, Tamang, and other Buddhist communities.
examplesRomanized: lhabab duchenma gumbama prarthana garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Prayers are offered at monasteries on Lhabab Duchen.

definitions: Observance of the Prophet Muhammad’s birthday with processions, sermons, and prayers.
Observed by Muslim communities in Tarai towns and urban centres across Nepal.
Celebrated by Nepali Muslims of diverse backgrounds.
examplesRomanized: id‑e‑miladma julus ra raunak dekhinchha.
exampleEnglish: Processions and celebrations are seen on Eid‑e‑Milad.

definitions: Night of forgiveness and prayers in Islamic tradition; people offer night vigils and charity.
Observed by Muslim communities in Tarai districts and Nepal’s cities.
Celebrated by Nepali Muslims across ethnic groups.
examples: शबे–बरातमा रातभर नमाज र दुवा गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: shab‑e‑baratma ratbhar namaz ra duwa garinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Shab‑e‑Barat, people pray through the night.

definitions: Christian festival celebrating the resurrection of Jesus; includes church services and family gatherings.
Observed by Christian communities nationwide, especially in urban congregations.
Celebrated by Nepali Christians; neighbours often extend greetings.
examplesRomanized: easterma churchma vishes aradhana garinchha.
exampleEnglish: Special worship services are held in churches on Easter.

definitions: Sita Jayanti (birth anniversary of Sita/Janaki) with rituals at Janaki Temple and homes.
Centred in Janakpur and Mithila region; observed by devotees across Nepal and India.
Celebrated by Maithil/Madhesi Hindus and Hindu devotees nationwide.
examples: जानकी नवमीमा जनकपुरको जानकी मन्दिरमा विशेष पूजा हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: janaki navamima janakpuro janaki mandirma vishes puja hunchha.
exampleEnglish: Special worship is held at Janaki Temple on Janaki Navami.

definitions: Maithili New Year (Baisakh 2) observed with water sprinkling, new beginnings, and community feasts.
Centred in the Mithila/Tarai region; observed by Maithil communities in towns and cities.
Celebrated primarily by Maithil communities; neighbours often join.
examples: जूर शीतलमा पानी छर्केर नयाँ वर्षको स्वागत गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: jur sitalma pani charkera naya barsako swagat garinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Jur Sital, people sprinkle water to welcome the New Year.

definitions: Month‑long Hindu observance where devotees recite the Swasthani tale and fast on specific days for blessings.
Observed nationwide during Paush/Magh with strong participation in Kathmandu Valley and hill towns.
Celebrated by Hindu households across diverse ethnic groups.
examples: स्वस्थानी व्रत कथामा दैनिक कथा सुन्ने गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: swasthani vrata kathama dainik katha sunne garinchha.
exampleEnglish: During Swasthani Brata Katha, the story is recited daily.

definitions: Newar festival of lights in Patan where devotees circle the city lighting lamps at stupas and shrines.
Centred in Lalitpur (Patan) within the Kathmandu Valley.
Celebrated primarily by Newar communities; residents of many groups join.
examples: मत्य:मा विहार र चैत्य वरिपरि दीप बालिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: matyama vihar ra chaitya waripari dip balinchha.
exampleEnglish: On Matya, lamps are lit around viharas and chaityas.

definitions: Ritual Newar masked dance cycle invoking the Nine Durgas, performed across months in Bhaktapur area.
Centred in Bhaktapur (Kathmandu Valley) with performances in neighbourhood squares and temples.
Celebrated by Newar communities; widely attended by visitors.
examples: नवदुर्गा नाचमा मुखौटे लगाएर देवदेवीको रूप प्रस्तुत हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: nava durga naachma mukhaute lagayera devdevi ko rup prastut hunchha.
exampleEnglish: In the Nava Durga Naach, masked dancers portray deities.

definitions: Sword festival associated with Dashain wherein ceremonial swords are displayed and paraded for protection rites.
Observed in Lalitpur/Kathmandu and several hill towns with local variations.
Celebrated by Newar and broader Hindu communities.
examplesRomanized: khadga jatramama khadgako puja garinchha.
exampleEnglish: During Khadga Jatra, ceremonial swords are worshipped.

definitions: Large fair at the Gadhimai temple held periodically; devotees seek blessings for prosperity and protection.
Centred in Bara district (Madhesh/Tarai) attracting pilgrims from Nepal and India.
Celebrated by Madhesi/Maithil Hindus and many other devotees.
examplesRomanized: gadhimai melama lakhau bhaktajan pugchhan.
exampleEnglish: Hundreds of thousands of devotees visit the Gadhimai Mela.

definitions: Pilgrimage fair to Tarkeshwor Mahadev with hill treks, worship, and community gatherings.
Observed in Tarkeshwor (northwest Kathmandu) and neighbouring hill communities.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees across ethnic groups.
examples: तारकेश्वर मेलामा भक्तजनले पहाड चढेर दर्शन गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: tarkeshwor melama bhaktajanele pahad chadera darshan garchhan.
exampleEnglish: At the Tarkeshwor Mela, devotees climb the hill for darshan.

definitions: Holy fair at Devghat on Maghe Sankranti where pilgrims bathe at the confluence and offer prayers.
Centred at Devghat (Chitwan/Tanahun) drawing pilgrims from central and western Nepal.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees from many ethnic communities.
examples: देवघाट मकर मेलामा स्नान र दान गर्ने चलन छ।
examplesRomanized: devghat makar melama snan ra dan garne chalan chha.
exampleEnglish: At the Devghat Makar Mela, people bathe and donate in charity.

definitions: Lo Manthang’s three‑day Vajrayana Buddhist festival reenacting the triumph of good over chaos with masked dances.
Centred in Mustang (Lo Manthang); draws pilgrims and visitors from across Nepal and abroad.
Celebrated by Tibetan‑Buddhist communities (Lopa) with participation from locals and tourists.
examples: तिजीमा ल्हामो नाच र धार्मिक अनुष्ठान हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: tijima lhamo naach ra dharmic anushthan hunchha.
exampleEnglish: During Tiji, there are sacred masked dances and rituals.

definitions: Sherpa community festival honouring Guru Rinpoche and local deities with feasts and dances.
Observed in Khumbu/Solukhumbu villages and Sherpa neighbourhoods of Kathmandu.
Celebrated by Sherpa communities; other Himalayan Buddhists attend.
examples: दुम्जीमा गाउँलेहरूले मिलेर पूजा र भोज गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: dumjima gauleharule milera puja ra bhoj garchhan.
exampleEnglish: At Dumji, villagers gather for worship and feasting.

definitions: Gurung spring dance‑drama narrating divine love and heroism, performed by young women in trance‑like devotion.
Prominent in Kaski, Lamjung, Tanahun and Gurung settlements in cities.
Celebrated primarily by Gurung (Tamu) communities; others attend as spectators.
examples: घाँटु नाच वैशाखतिर गाउँमा प्रस्तुत हुन्छ।
examplesRomanized: ghatu naach baisaakh tira gauma prastut hunchha.
exampleEnglish: Ghatu Naach is performed in villages during Baisakh.

definitions: Tharu festival marking Krishna Janmashtami with wall‑painted Ashtimki art and community rituals.
Centred in Tharu areas of the Tarai; celebrated in villages and town colonies.
Celebrated primarily by Tharu communities.
examplesRomanized: ashtimkima gharko bhittama chitra banainchha.
exampleEnglish: On Ashtimki, wall paintings are made at home.

definitions: Month‑long devotion to Madhav Narayan (Vishnu) with river ablutions and daily pilgrimages carrying kalash.
Prominent along Hanumanghat/Bhaktapur and Sankhu areas; observed across the Valley.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees (especially Newar Vaishnavs).
examples: माधव नारायण व्रतमा भक्तजनले कलश बोकेर तीर्थ गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: madhav narayan vratma bhaktajanele kalash boker tirtha garchhan.
exampleEnglish: During the Madhav Narayan vow, devotees carry pots on pilgrimages.

definitions: Janai Purnima fair at Kumbheshwar temple and pond with ritual bathing and thread ceremony.
Centred in Patan/Lalitpur (Kathmandu Valley).
Celebrated by Hindu devotees across ethnic groups.
examples: कुम्भेश्वर मेलामा पाँचधारा दहमा स्नान गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: kumbheshwar melama panchdhara dahma snan garinchha.
exampleEnglish: At Kumbheshwar Mela, devotees bathe in the five‑spout pond.

definitions: Grand Newar Buddhist almsgiving held periodically with displays of Dipankara Buddha and mass dana.
Held in Patan (Nagbahal) and Kathmandu (Basantapur) at multiyear intervals.
Celebrated by Newar Buddhists; thousands participate.
examples: सम्यक महादानमा डिपंकर बुद्धको प्रदर्शनी गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: samyak mahadanma dipankar buddha ko pradarshani garinchha.
exampleEnglish: During Samyak Mahadan, Dipankara Buddhas are displayed for almsgiving.

definitions: Periodic holy fair at Shey Gompa in Upper Dolpo, combining pilgrimage, prayers, and community gathering.
Centred in Shey Phoksundo/Upper Dolpo region; draws Himalayan pilgrims.
Celebrated by Tibetan‑Buddhist communities and local Dolpo‑pa.
examples: शे गोम्पा मेलामा दूरदराजका तीर्थयात्री आइपुग्छन्।
examplesRomanized: she gompa melama durdarajka tirthayatri aipugchhan.
exampleEnglish: Pilgrims from far regions arrive for the Shey Gompa Mela.

definitions: Pilgrimage fair to Halesi Mahadev cave‑temple, revered by Hindus, Buddhists, and Kirats.
Centred in Khotang district; devotees arrive from eastern hills and beyond.
Celebrated by Hindu, Buddhist, and Kirat communities.
examples: हलेसी महादेव मेलामा भक्तजन गुफा मन्दिरमा पूजा गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: halesi mahadev melama bhaktajan gufa mandirma puja garchhan.
exampleEnglish: At Halesi Mahadev Mela, devotees worship at the cave temple.

definitions: Temple fair at Manakamana where devotees pray for wishes and offer prasad; seasonal crowds peak on auspicious days.
Centred in Gorkha district; pilgrims come via cable car and trails from across Nepal.
Celebrated by Hindu devotees across ethnic groups.
examples: मनकामना मेलामा भक्तजनले मान मनाउने पूजा गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: manakamana melama bhaktajanele man manauNe puja garchhan.
exampleEnglish: At the Manakamana Mela, devotees perform wish‑fulfilling rituals.

definitions: Pilgrim fair at Muktinath temple, a sacred site for Hindus and Buddhists with 108 spouts for ritual bathing.
Centred in Mustang (Jomsom/Muktinath) drawing pilgrims from Nepal and India.
Celebrated by Hindu Vaishnavs and Himalayan Buddhists.
examples: मुक्तिनाथ मेलामा १०८ धारामा स्नान गर्ने चलन छ।
examplesRomanized: muktinath melama 108 dharama snan garne chalan chha.
exampleEnglish: At Muktinath Mela, devotees bathe in the 108 spouts.

definitions: Temple fair at Pathibhara Devi, a powerful wish‑fulfilling goddess of the eastern Himalaya.
Centred in Taplejung district; eastern hill pilgrims and Darjeeling/Sikkim devotees visit.
Celebrated by Hindu and Kirat communities.
examples: पाथिभरा मेलामा भक्तजनले देवीको दर्शन गर्छन्।
examplesRomanized: pathibhara melama bhaktajanele deviko darshan garchhan.
exampleEnglish: At Pathibhara Mela, devotees take darshan of the goddess.

definitions: Unique Newar festival of Bode famed for the tongue‑piercing ritual and community processions.
Centred in Bode (Bhaktapur) within the Kathmandu Valley.
Celebrated by Newar communities; widely watched by visitors.
examples: बोडे जात्रामामा जिब्रो छेड्ने अनुष्ठान प्रसिद्ध छ।
examplesRomanized: bode jatramama jibro chhedne anushthan prasiddha chha.
exampleEnglish: The tongue‑piercing rite is famous during Bode Jatra.

definitions: Newar festival venerating Pachali Bhairav with processions, feasts, and communal rituals by guthis.
Observed in Kathmandu (Teku/Pachali area) and Newar neighbourhoods.
Celebrated by Newar communities; city residents join.
examples: पचली भैरव जात्रामामा भैरवको रथ तानिन्छ र पूजाआजा गरिन्छ।
examplesRomanized: pachali bhairav jatramama bhairavko rath taninchha ra puja aaja garinchha.
exampleEnglish: During Pachali Bhairav Jatra, Bhairav’s chariot is pulled and rituals are performed.

definitions: Rite of seclusion and initiation for Newar girls (Kumari Pravesh) accompanied by family feasts and worship.
Observed in Kathmandu Valley and Newar towns.
Celebrated by Newar communities as a lifecycle festival.
examplesRomanized: gufa pujama balikalai shubhashish diinchha.
exampleEnglish: Blessings are bestowed upon the girl during Gufa Puja.
